due to the large number of humanoid fossils that has been found here. 13 well explored fossil sites and over 200 caves are located within the cradle. The site covers an area of around 47 000 hectares and offers a variety of tourist attractions.
, take exit 80 Roodepoort (M8 14th Ave) and get onto Hendrik Potgieter road (M47) heading north. Hendrik Potgieter will become the N14 and lead directly into the Cradle of Humankind.

value: directions=From the N1 in Johannesburg take exit 80 Roodepoort (M8 14th Ave) and get onto Hendrik Potgieter road (M47) heading north. Hendrik Potgieter will become the N14, at the T-junction with the R563, turn right, follow the R563 for about 3km, Living Jewels will be on your left.
content=Home to the South African Carnivorous Plant Society
directions=West along the N14 and look for the
price=R80 for adults, R50 for children between 4 to 14 years old, R60 for pensioners, children under age of 4 for free
content=A tour guide will lead you through this extensive cave system where many early hominids and advanced ape fossils were discovered.
Note that it is a 2 km walk
. You can also visit the museum to learn more about the evolution of man. There is also a restaurant and shop.
The tunnel of time at Maropeng, timeline from the present into the past depicted on the floor and walls.

directions=From Krugersdorp, follow the R563 north to the R400, turn left into the R400, Maropeng will be on your left about 1.7km further. From Tshwane, follow the N14 west until it reaches the R563, then follow the directions as above. From the N1 in Johannesburg take exit 80 Roodepoort (M8 14th Ave) and get onto Hendrik Potgieter road (M47) heading north. Hendrik Potgieter will become the N14, follow directions as above.
price=Visitors centre: R80 for adults, R45 for children, R60 for pensioners.

content=The Cradle of Mankind exhibition and education centre. Mostly aimed at students, but fascinating for anyone interested in human origins. The short underground boat ride is a must do activity. At the entrance there is a ATM, coffee shop and souvenir shop. Within the centre, the Tumulus Restaurant is located on the first floor and the Tumulus bar is located on the second floor.
name=Rhino & Lion Nature reserve (Including the Wonder Caves)
content=A nature reserve within the Cradle.
The viewing deck of the Tumulus at Maropeng Centre

directions=From the N14 or the N1, follow the R512 north. Look out for the Cradle signpost to the left just past Lanseria airport, it will indicate a left turn into Kromdraai road (D540). Follow Kromdraai and the Cradle will be on your right
content=A nature reserve and restaurant within the Cradle of Humankind.
Reserve in advance for the restaurant as they are generally fully booked.

directions=Follow the N14 north until the T-junction with the R563, turn right and follow the R563 for about 10km (take are not to take the Tarlton/Venterdorp road to the left about 2.5km from the T-junction), signpost will indicate Greensleeves on your left.
hours=Open Fri and Sat 7PM till late, costume hire and dressing from 6:30PM
address=First floor of the Tumulus at Maropeng
hours=Open to the public on Sundays only
price=R185 for adults and R80 for kids
content=Buffet lunch.  The bar provides an awesome view overlooking the Magaliesberg and the Witwatersberg mountains.
address=At the On the D400 at the Maropeng visitors centre

directions=From Krugersdorp, follow the R563 north to the R400, turn left into the R400, Maropeng will be on your left about 1.7km further. From Tshwane, follow the N14 west until it reaches the R563, then follow the directions as above. From Johannesburg take exit 80 Roodepoort (M8 14th Ave) and get onto Hendrik Potgieter road (M47) heading north. Hendrik Potgieter will become the N14, follow directions as above.
price=Visitors centre: R80 for adults, R45 for children, R60 for pensioners.
address=Letamo Game Farm, Bartlett Road, Kromdraai
directions=From the N14/M47 intersection, follow the N14 north for 4km. Turn right into Bartlett road and follow this dirt road for about 3km to the entrance.

content=Views of the valley from the evolution-themed luxury suites with roofs covered in African veld. The onsite Roots restaurant was voted as one of the Top 10 restaurants in the country (2007 and 2008). Reservations essential. No children under 12.
